channel.title: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?
channel.description: What can you do in your server to ensure it makes a good economy? Such as avoiding inflation to where rares are 2b+.

item.title: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:19, topic:450386”]Good luck with no currency. There’s always going to be currency, in an rsps atleast.

Everyone is throwing out wild ideas, I would just stick with the conventional route and just make rare drops actually be rare, clue scroll rewards more rare, ect…[/quote]

How does that solve anything? That doesn’t even address the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:16, topic:450386”]an interesting system to implement would be one where resources are practically limited, and in the beginning there are a lot of resources, yet over time the amount of resources grows scarcer so you end up with the interesting scenario where resource scarcity has hit the point where new resources trickle into the economy at a remarkably slow rate and people have to make do with what they have.

i’ve also toyed with the idea of removing GP from the game and just watching what evolve as alternatives, i’d expect people to trade in resources (wood, ore, gems etc.) or for some bizzare item to turn up as a currency (arrow shafts, iron daggers ???).

i’m not guaranteeing that these things contribute a ‘good’ economy, just an experimental one which may end up being interesting to observe…[/quote]

Finite resources would lead to long-term problems.

If you take a macroeconomic look at a game economy, you will see the same fundamental flaws in almost all major rpg games. There’s a classic issue of superinflation. Resources are unlimited, therefore, all the items that can be produced (including gold in terms of monster drops, alchemy, and selling to stores) are also unlimited. In a real economy, you can regulate the cash flow using monetary policy, such as shredding old bills or selling bonds. Games don’t have good solutions like this, so you have to try another approach. Money sinks are a good way to try and reduce the hyperinflation of gold, but they don’t solve the issues of items. Items are unlimited so long as resources are. You could use finite resources like s1gma suggested, but then eventually your player base will completely dry out a world and it won’t be fun anymore. You could scale resources relative to the number of players, but isn’t trivial. The best solution in my opinion would be to have degrading armors. All armors eventually need to be repaired or will break (and therefore, need to be replaced). Doing this properly will allow for resources to always be demanded and, because armor is a pure loss of money, will also aid in balancing the amount of currency in the game.

Properly balancing the above can get very tricky. I won’t leave speljohan out of this, though! There are ways of avoiding the problem altogether, such as removing currency. If people are trading items for items, then the supply and demand is based on need and desire. It will take a lot longer for an economy to super inflate without a currency fueling it. It would still help to use degraded armors or conditionally finite resources, but those wouldn’t impact the game play as much in this scenario.

Read full topic
item.source: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?

i’ve also toyed with the idea of removing GP from the game and just watching what evolve as alternatives, i’d expect people to trade in resources (wood, ore, gems etc.) or for some bizzare item to turn up as a currency (arrow shafts, iron daggers ???).

item.title: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

an interesting system to implement would be one where resources are practically limited, and in the beginning there are a lot of resources, yet over time the amount of resources grows scarcer so you end up with the interesting scenario where resource scarcity has hit the point where new resources trickle into the economy at a remarkably slow rate and people have to make do with what they have.

i’ve also toyed with the idea of removing GP from the game and just watching what evolve as alternatives, i’d expect people to trade in resources (wood, ore, gems etc.) or for some bizzare item to turn up as a currency (arrow shafts, iron daggers ???).

i’m not guaranteeing that these things contribute a ‘good’ economy, just an experimental one which may end up being interesting to observe…

item.source: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?

item.title: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:14, topic:450386”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=553270.msg4056268#msg4056268 date=1342994673]

A good economy is very simple.

  1. There is a good amount of resources that players can make money off of
  2. The rate that money is produced is relatively slow, ie; maybe first 1m takes 1week?
  3. The scarcity of items are higher valued, compared the lower ones (official RS prices are generally OKAY)

[/quote]1m a week? people would hate that, you can make 1m a day on rs.

You need to remember that at the start of a runescape private server, the economy is clean. There is no gp in circulation. You could spend a week getting 100k but you would be richer than a lot of other people.

Amount of gp earned per week is relative to the server. It is too specific a statement for all servers in general.[/quote]
Like I said, it all depends on how much gold is in actual circulation, that’s why some economies on many servers are fucking shit, they say “dclaws are 400m” when there’s not even 100 in circulation.

Read full topic
item.source: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?

item.title: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:13, topic:450386”][quote author=shahrukh1 link=topic=553270.msg4054688#msg4054688 date=1342829085]
A good economy is very simple.

  1. There is a good amount of resources that players can make money off of
  2. The rate that money is produced is relatively slow, ie; maybe first 1m takes 1week?
  3. The scarcity of items are higher valued, compared the lower ones (official RS prices are generally OKAY)

[/quote]1m a week? people would hate that, you can make 1m a day on rs.[/quote]

You need to remember that at the start of a runescape private server, the economy is clean. There is no gp in circulation. You could spend a week getting 100k but you would be richer than a lot of other people.

Amount of gp earned per week is relative to the server. It is too specific a statement for all servers in general.

Read full topic
item.source: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?

item.title: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:2, topic:450386”]Most servers now add stupid ass “2b tokens” or money vaults that you can store unlimited money into.

My point is you shouldn’t be able to get that much money. These weren’t added to RuneScape because it shouldn’t be possible. The main problem with server economy are dupes and donations. Fix all your dupes… and donations need to be handled in ways where you cannot gain an unfair advantage over another player, but still make donating worth while. And also rare drops should actually be RARE.[/quote]

Everything said in this quote is correct. Also, you want to make it so that skills interweave with each other and connect. If you have a good economy, then there’s going to be a ‘system’ in place.

Read full topic
item.source: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?

item.title: What makes a good economy in a RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Most servers now add stupid ass “2b tokens” or money vaults that you can store unlimited money into.

My point is you shouldn’t be able to get that much money. These weren’t added to RuneScape because it shouldn’t be possible. The main problem with server economy are dupes and donations. Fix all your dupes… and donations need to be handled in ways where you cannot gain an unfair advantage over another player, but still make donating worth while. And also rare drops should actually be RARE.

Read full topic
